description.narrative: By 2017, national level education policies and strategies demonstrate greater gender and social equity, which contributes to Education â€“ General, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Equity â€“ Focus On Girls' And Inclusive Education, Learning Outcomes, Policy Advocacy â€“ Urban, Civil Society, Parliament, Environment. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2017, national policies, legislation, plans, budgets, coordination and monitoring mechanisms are enabling the survival, development, protection and participation rights of children, adolescents, and women, to be fulfilled with equity in all contexts, including humanitarian situations

sector.narrative: Education Management Information System (EMIS) (excluding learning assessment systems)
Education sector planning including coordinating role, SDG 4, etc.
System strengthening - curricula and learning materials design (excluding early-learning / pre-primary)
System strengthening - inclusive education for children with disabilities
Technical assistance - Equitable access to quality education

description.narrative: Development Partner affairs Technical staff services

title.narrative: Nepal United Nations Development Assistance Framework
UNICEF Policy on Harmonized Approach to Cash Transfers to Implementing Partners
UNICEF Procedure on Harmonized Approach to Cash Transfers to Implementing Partners
UNICEF procedure for programme implementation partnerships
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
Nepal 2020 Annual Report on Results for Children
UNICEF Tender Notices through the UN Global Marketplace

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2017, national level education policies and strategies demonstrate greater gender and social equity

description.narrative: Together with UNICEF as development partners focal point, the Government has achieved a 22.4 per cent reduction of (24,090) out of school children in 5 districts with the highest disparities in education outcomes. A pro-poor targeted scholarship directive was approved that will be informed by a targeting criteria. | Status:Met | As-of Date:31/12/2017

title.narrative: Evidence-based research related to gender and social equity used in education policies and strategies

target.value: 2017:Recommendations from at least 3 case studies on Social Norms; 3 case studies on Best Practices; 2 studies (ECD, urban) and 1 Evaluation (CFS) used in policies and strategies

actual.value: 2017:9 studies and recommendations incorporated in SSDP, Equity Strategy, Suggestion Box Guidelines for schools

title.narrative: National Education Equity Strategy developed to facilitate greater gender and social equity (e.g. gender, children with disabilities, geographically/ socio-economically disadvantaged children, children living with HIV or affected by AIDS etc.)

baseline.value: Girls Education Strategy Paper and other equity-oriented measures (i.e. scholarships, language policy, school meals, etc.)

actual.value: 2017:The development of Equity Strategy Implementation Plans (ESIPs) for provincial and local level has been agreed
